You just looted your first armor, congratulations. However it might not be readily useable. Let's learn how to repair it.
 
Each armor belongs to an armor class. Each class has a corresponding armor repair kit:
 • Light
 • Medium
 • Heavy
 • Exo
 
All of these (except exo repair kits) can be looted, or crafted with the appropriate toolkits and components.
To be able to craft an exo repair kit you need to find the crafting recipe for it first.

Armor related items can be broken down into 4 categories:
 • Repair kits
 • Repair items
 • Support items
 • Components
 
Repair kits
You need one to be able to swap components.
 
Repair items
These are used for field reparis. The numbers indicate the minimum overall armor condition required to use it.
 
Support items
During a repair these items can be added to boost the base condition gain from a repair. Some repair items can also be support items.
 
Components
These items are what armors are comprised of. These can only be swapped at a workbench. The armors overall condition is determined by the condition of it's components.

If you have a repair item that can repair the armor at it's current overall condition all you have to do is right click the repair item and click use (or double click) then select the support material (if you want to use one) and click repair.\n \nBelow a certain condition (dictated by the armor class' repair kit) you can no longer field repair an armor and have to swap parts at a workbench.
